# Medication Delivery Service

## Title
The requirement is for a Medication Delivery Service for the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) in the Atlantic Region.

## Description
This requirement involves transporting medication from the Atlantic Regional Pharmacy in Moncton, New Brunswick, to various CSC locations in the region. The contractor must deliver and pick up medication supplies daily, following the schedule provided below.

## Objectives
- Deliver medication supplies to CSC locations as per the schedule.
- Pickup medication supplies from CSC locations for return to the Atlantic Regional Pharmacy.
- Provide delivery services 5 days a week, Monday to Friday.
- Adjust the delivery schedule as required by CSC.

## Required Services
- Delivery and pickup of medication supplies in totes.
- Provide security cleared drivers for the service.
- Use a chain of signatures to verify the quantity of medication supplies shipped.

## Work Schedule
- Driver #1: Monday, Wednesday, Friday, 11:30 am - 4:00 pm.
- Driver #2: Monday to Friday, 9:00 am - 4:00 pm.
- Other than the regularly scheduled deliveries, occasional pickups and deliveries of medication to and from local public health and hospital clinics will be required.

## Permits and Requirements
- Contractor must ensure drivers are security cleared.
- Contractor must store medication in a secure vehicle at ambient temperature controlled conditions.
- Contractor must notify CS if delayed or detained.
- Contractor will not be paid if services are not provided due to inclement weather.

## Documents
The full statement of work and evaluation criteria can be downloaded from Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.

## Important Notes
- Bidders can request a debriefing within 15 working days of receiving the bid solicitation process results.
- Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers free seminars on selling goods and services to the Government of Canada.

## Trade Agreements
This procurement falls under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and supplier registration is not required for Indigenous Businesses.

The tender closes on August 18, 2023, at 1:00 pm.
